intro: Napus rapa, commonly known as field mustard, is an annual or biennial plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its cruciform flowers and pinnately lobed leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and produces long, slender pods containing seeds. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in disturbed soils, roadsides, and agricultural fields. Its seeds are small, black, and often used in traditional medicine and as a spice.
